availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Territory of Colorado
First Judicial District } ss

I, Isaac I. Moore. of the city of Denver in said Territory, do solemnly swear, that I will support the Constitution of the United States of America, the Constitution of the State of Kentucky and the Organic Law of the Territory of Colorado, and that I will in all things to the best of my ability execute and perform the duties of Commissioner of Deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky while residing in the said Territory, so help me God.

Territory of Colorado
First Judicial District } ss

I, B. B. Stiles Clerk of the Supreme Court of the United States of America within and for said Territory hereby certify, that, Isaac I Moore who is personally known to me to be the same person who subscribed the above instrument in writing, appeared before me this day and took the oath, as required by the Law of said Territory.
Witness my hand and the seal of said Supreme Court at Denver in said Teritory this 23d day of Octo. AD 1861

Colorado Territory
Isaac I. Moore
Comr. of Deeds
Denver City
Filed Nov 21. 1861
